extendedInfo.description: Food fight is a wonderfully bright original story which tells the story of Tim, a boy from earth and Sammy, a sausage from somewhere else altogether. They meet and instantly dislike each other, but are they so different after all?â¨As they work through their differences, Tim and Sammy deal with issues of one-sidedness, prejudgement, food intolerance and ultimately, conflict resolution all in a light heated, fun story.See the trailer (iOS) here:http://www.jellybiscuits.com/?page_id=390* Built for Tablets* Studio recorded voice reading by the author of the book, Glenn Melenhorst, with word-by-word highlighting.* Word by word narration - touch a word to have it read to you.* Automatic page turn option to have the whole book read to you, or Reads As You Turn.* Mini map for fast navigation through the book. Easily jump to any page (just tap timmy's head), and control Read modes. * 3D interactive page turns* Interactive content on every page* High quality sound and motion.* Find the 5 hidden stars to unlock a bonus page - the hunt changes every time it is reset!* Conversion and enhancement of a popular childrens book, with the author and developer working closely to bring the book to life.* Over 80 interactive elements and sounds* Book aligns to any orientation * In portrait orientation the auto-read zooms in on the individual pages as the book is read.* Bonus silly mode when all 5 stars are found. Hear the author read in a squeaky voice. :)

reviews.title: Its OK but
reviews.comment: Its OK. The graphics are good and funny story but it is now where near as interactive as Sassys Easter Adventure or Little Faces of Halloween. They have a lot going on with games and coloring book.
reviews.author: Larry Meadows

reviews.title: Gr8 fun
reviews.comment: Food Fight is wonderful fun for my 4 yr old & adults too. Slice of Bread glitches, animation, sound & page turning work erratically. Had to refund. What a disappointment! We\'d so looked forward to this release.
reviews.author: Mary Hare

reviews.title: Great story for adults & their kids
reviews.comment: My daughter and I love this book. The illustrations are great and the story is funny albeit with a wicked sense of humor. (Some parents may object to boy-eating aliens but it helped the book\'s lesson of needing to add vegetables to one\'s diet.)  I do have a few suggestions. I like how the book was interactive, however; I would have liked if the book was ALSO able to display and say words when clicking on objects in the book similar to how other interactive books behave: i.e. \"Hop on Pop\". Perhaps the developer could add that feature and allow users to turn the feature on or off. (5 stars if this could be done)  Another observation is that the book was wonderfully narrated with a British man\'s voice except when a little boy\'s voice is used to list the names of the different types of sausages, which was difficult to discern. Perhaps that part could be recorded again so it is easier to understand.  Overall, a great book!
reviews.author: Jack Hand

reviews.title: Great book!
reviews.comment: My boy and I love this book!  We seem to find something new each time we read it.  Hope they come out with more books soon!
reviews.author: Jeff Fisher

reviews.title: great
reviews.comment: Kids love this one. I think the interactivey is superb, and the graphics are beautifully done. Can\'t wait for your next release.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: great on the xoom, great book
reviews.comment: Almost perfect on the xoom. Sometimes you have to start it twice but once it gets startet the app works great. Really makes the tablet come to life. My 5 year old has spent probably 2 hours total playing with this book.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Wish there were more kids stories like this!
reviews.comment: A little glitchy at times. Great kids story. My son enjoyed this from 3-5 years so far.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Cute Story, Needs to be Optimized
reviews.comment: Works well on the Transformer, but it doesn\'t utilize all of the screen.  You can tell they haven\'t optimized the ipad version for Android\'s 16:9 screens.  It also runs a little sluggish compared to some of the other excellent app books in the market.  I look forward to the next story.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Excellent app. I had a problem installing it initially, and found out that my rooted EVO had a temporary file that may have been blocking it. Love it.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Technology wise, the app is great. Story wise, I\'m not sure its such a good idea to talk about kids being eaten in a children\'s book.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: My 3 year old daughter loves it!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: did not work on my zenithink zt 180
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Well Ireally liked it a lot. I mean a real lot. :) I say buy it, it\'s fun
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good times
reviews.comment: Great interactive book with lots of bells and whistles.  My son like searching for the hidden stars in order to get to the bonus coloring page.  I give it 4 of 5 stars due to the slow response to turning the pages.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: My kids love it.
reviews.comment: I don\'t know why there aren\'t more downloads, this is one of my favorite children\'s stories on Google Play!
reviews.author: A Google User
